headline: Booz Allen Awarded $315 Million Rapid Prototyping Contract to Transform Command and Control for the U.S. Air Force
summary: MCLEAN, Va., July 22, 2025--Booz Allen Hamilton (NYSE: BAH) today announced it was awarded a $315 million contract with a maximum performance period of up to five years to deliver the Advanced Battle Management System (ABMS) Distributed Battle Management Node (DBMN) Phase II Tactical Operations Center-Light (TOC-L) prototype for the Department of the Air Force Program Executive Office for Command, Control, Communications, and Battle Management (DAF PEO C3BM). Booz Allen is partnering with L3Harr

content.title: Booz Allen Awarded $315 Million Rapid Prototyping Contract to Transform Command and Control for the U.S. Air Force
content.summary: MCLEAN, Va., July 22, 2025--Booz Allen Hamilton (NYSE: BAH) today announced it was awarded a $315 million contract with a maximum performance period of up to five years to deliver the Advanced Battle Management System (ABMS) Distributed Battle Management Node (DBMN) Phase II Tactical Operations Center-Light (TOC-L) prototype for the Department of the Air Force Program Executive Office for Command, Control, Communications, and Battle Management (DAF PEO C3BM). Booz Allen is partnering with L3Harr
